Hello! I have a 3-dimensional array A and I would like to vertically concatenate along the third dimension. This can be done, for example, using `vcat(A[:,:,1],A[:,:,2])` .
But `size(A) = (128,8,6)` . Is there a better way than writing `vcat(A[:,:,1],A[:,:,2],A[:,:,3],A[:,:,4],A[:,:,5],A[:,:,6])` ? It's useful for me to know as I may end having a number >>> 6. Thanks!
